title.narrative: Social protection research and knowledge sharing

description.narrative: The Strategy for Australia’s aid in social protection (2015) commits to strengthening partner government and other stakeholders knowledge on social protection through investing in a research, knowledge exchange and training for counterparts in partner governments and other development partners. In addition to traditional face-to-face training, the program brings together practitioners from across the globe to directly share their experiences with each other, and facilitate continued exchange via online platforms. The investment will be completed in early 2018 and will deliver direct training to over 100 government counterparts. It will engage over 300 partners in knowledge exchange both in person and online, and deliver three new practical research reports on issues ranging from disability and social protection, integrated data for social protection, and enhancing links between social protection and employment.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
